title: [feature request]  ‘floordiv’ operator in pytorch
body_html:
Pytorch Tensors are missing a ‘floordiv’ operator, is this intentional? With some direction, I'd be happy to implement this and send a pull request.

I considered adding def __floordiv__(self, other) to torch/tensor.py but I think the floor() function isn't available in _TensorBase.

PS: I'm trying to write code that works on both NumPy Arrays and Pytorch Tensors.
Eaxmple:

a = b//c              # (works with numpy, not pytorch)
a = (b/c).floor()     # (works with pytorch, not numpy)
body_text:
Pytorch Tensors are missing a ‘floordiv’ operator, is this intentional? With some direction, I'd be happy to implement this and send a pull request.
I considered adding def __floordiv__(self, other) to torch/tensor.py but I think the floor() function isn't available in _TensorBase.
PS: I'm trying to write code that works on both NumPy Arrays and Pytorch Tensors.
Eaxmple:
a = b//c              # (works with numpy, not pytorch)
a = (b/c).floor()     # (works with pytorch, not numpy)
body:
Pytorch Tensors are missing a ‘floordiv’ operator, is this intentional? With some direction, I'd be happy to implement this and send a pull request.

I considered adding `def __floordiv__(self, other)` to [torch/tensor.py](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/tensor.py#L293) but I think the `floor()` function isn't available in `_TensorBase`.

PS: I'm trying to write code that works on both NumPy Arrays and Pytorch Tensors.
Eaxmple:
```
a = b//c              # (works with numpy, not pytorch)
a = (b/c).floor()     # (works with pytorch, not numpy)
```
